abilities.name: Size Manipulation
abilities.description: Allows the user to shrink down to 5 millimeters in height or return to their original size, and any size in between. The user maintains their original strength regardless of size.

abilities.name: Mini Mini Full Rebound
abilities.description: The technique used to transform from miniature size back to full original giant size.

keyMoments.title: Mini Mini no Mi Revealed
keyMoments.description: Lily reveals she is a giant who ate the Mini Mini no Mi, forcing her to live at a miniature 5mm size.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of the Mini Mini no Mi in the anime (previously appeared in video game One Piece: Round the Land).

keyMoments.title: First Transformation to Giant Form
keyMoments.description: Lily demonstrates the Mini Mini Full Rebound technique, transforming from 5mm to her full giant size.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of the fruit's transformation ability and its unique property of maintaining strength at any size.

strengths: User can become extremely small (5mm) for stealth and infiltration
Maintains full strength regardless of size
Can adjust to any size between minimum and maximum
Useful for both combat and espionage
weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (inability to swim, Sea-Prism Stone)
Small size can make user vulnerable to being overlooked or accidentally harmed
trivia: This Devil Fruit previously appeared in the video game One Piece: Round the Land with a different user named Blyue
Lily is the second non-canon giant shown to have consumed a Devil Fruit
The fruit's ability is particularly ironic for a giant, as it forces them to be small rather than enhancing their natural size

abilities.name: Age Regression
abilities.description: Allows the user to produce energy orbs that make anyone or anything they touch 12 years younger. Multiple touches can regress age further.

keyMoments.title: Ain Introduced as Modo Modo no Mi User
keyMoments.description: Ain is introduced as a Neo Marine officer who possesses the Modo Modo no Mi, though the ability is not demonstrated in this episode.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the Return Return Fruit user, though powers not yet shown.

strengths: Can weaken opponents by making them younger and less experienced
Can reverse aging on objects to restore or weaken them
Multiple applications can regress targets beyond birth, effectively erasing them
weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (inability to swim, Sea-Prism Stone)
Requires physical contact or projectile hit to work
Effects may not work on certain targets
trivia: The fruit's ability is revealed in this episode but not demonstrated until later episodes
One of the most dangerous non-canon Devil Fruits due to its ability to erase people from existence

abilities.name: Plant Manipulation
abilities.description: Allows the user to super-accelerate the growth of plants and control the enlarged vegetation for combat and defense.

keyMoments.title: Binz Introduced as Mosa Mosa no Mi User
keyMoments.description: Binz is introduced as a Neo Marine officer who possesses the Mosa Mosa no Mi, though the ability is not demonstrated in this episode.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the Grow Grow Fruit user.

strengths: Can rapidly grow plants for attack, defense, or restraint
weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (inability to swim, Sea-Prism Stone)
Requires plants or seeds to be present
Fire-based attacks can counter plant growth
trivia: The fruit's ability is revealed in this episode but not demonstrated until later episodes
Binz's ninja-like appearance complements the stealth and binding potential of his plant powers

abilities.name: Alpaca Transformation
abilities.description: Allows an inanimate object (bazooka) to transform into an alpaca form, granting it mobility and sentience.

abilities.name: Weaponized Form
abilities.description: Can shoot cannonballs from mouth in both forms, combining animal mobility with weapon functionality.

keyMoments.title: Alpacacino's Zoan Fruit Revealed
keyMoments.description: Alpacacino is introduced as a bazooka that ate a Zoan Devil Fruit, becoming the first non-canon inanimate object with Zoan powers.
keyMoments.significance: Unique case of an inanimate object consuming a Zoan fruit and gaining animal characteristics.

strengths: Grants mobility and intelligence to an inanimate weapon
Retains weapon functionality in transformed state
Can use Armament Haki to enhance attacks
Loyal companion providing both combat and support
weaknesses: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (though as an object, may have different interactions)
Limited by being fundamentally a weapon rather than a living being
trivia: Alpacacino is the first non-canon inanimate object shown to have eaten a Zoan Devil Fruit
The name is a play on actor Al Pacino and the alpaca species
Alpacacino can use Armament Haki despite being originally an inanimate object
The specific name of the Devil Fruit was never revealed
